Name: Stele of Haounefer
Description: This stele in limestone, which was part of the Anastasi collection and then of the collection of Ã‰. de Meester de Ravestein, belongs to Haounefer, a "Government official (idenout?) of the estate of Amenhotep II (Aa-kheper-Re)". The monument is divided into two scenes: at the top, on e notices the owner in an attitude of prayer before the god Osiris; at the bottom, Haounefer and his wife, sitting on seats, receive offerings from their son and their three daughters. The stele is distinguished by many well preserved colours.
